title: Hyperion
extract: In Greek mythology, Hyperion (/haɪˈpɪəriən/; Greek: Ὑπερίων, translit. Hyperíōn, "The High-One") was one of the twelve Titan children of Gaia (Earth) and Uranus (Sky) who, led by Cronus, overthrew their father Uranus and were themselves later overthrown by the Olympians.
extract_html: In Greek mythology, Hyperion (/haɪˈpɪəriən/; Greek: Ὑπερίων, translit. Hyperíōn, "The High-One") was one of the twelve Titan children of Gaia (Earth) and Uranus (Sky) who, led by Cronus, overthrew their father Uranus and were themselves later overthrown by the Olympians.
